definition: angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale

sentences.english: I don't know in which corner the cat is hiding.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道那隻貓躲在哪個犄角旮旯裏。

sentences.english: The fence remained intact but the ram injured its own horns.
sentences.chinese: 結果籬笆紋絲不動，它反把自己的犄角碰傷了。

sentences.english: She likes to ask trite questions.
sentences.chinese: 她喜歡問犄角旮旯兒的問題。

sentences.english: He took his seat in an unobserved corner of the assembly room.
sentences.chinese: 他在會議室一個不爲人注意的犄角坐下來。

sentences.english: "Here, unicorn, " said the man, and he pulled up a lily and gave it to him.
sentences.chinese: 他說獨角獸的前額正中有一隻金色的犄角。

sentences.english: The two barricades united formed a veritable redoubt.
sentences.chinese: 這兩處街壘連在一道便構成一座真正的犄角堡。

sentences.english: See here, You need to wipe the corner as well.
sentences.chinese: 看這裏，犄角旮襤也要擦的。

sentences.english: This kind of insect can be found in every nook and corner in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 北京任何一個犄角旮旯兒都能看見這種蟲子。

sentences.english: Some kinds of deer shed their horns.
If I could no longer hold on to the handrail, those horns would spear me.
sentences.chinese: 如果我抓不住扶手，這對犄角就會把我刺穿。

sentences.english: "He told me it had a golden horn in the middle of its forehead," she said.
sentences.chinese: 他說獨角獸的前額正中有一隻金色的犄角。

sentences.english: A bugling red deer stag, or Cervus elaphus, in Denmark.
sentences.chinese: 丹麥一個長犄角的紅色成年壯鹿。

definition: variant of 榔頭|榔头[lang2 tou5]
white hair (of animals)/see also 白髮|白发[bai2 fa4]
White Tiger (the seven mansions of the west sky)/(slang) hairless female genitalia
both ends/both parties to a deal
